immutable_prompts.description: My ultimate goal is to one day build an underwater city, and I am focused on collecting the skills, connecting with people, and understanding the resources necessary to achieve this. I am deeply interested in the multidisciplinary aspects of creating and inhabiting underwater environments. This encompasses robotics for subsea construction and maintenance, the unique challenges of underwater architecture and structural engineering, and innovations in materials science like 3D concrete printing for marine applications. My interests also include the geology of the underwater world, the integration of marine ecosystems (including diverse fish populations) with human-made structures, and the human experience of exploring these environments through scuba diving and freediving. I am keen on learning about seasteading concepts and practical implementations as potential pathways or related endeavors. I'm looking for technical papers, case studies, project proposals, and discussions that contribute to this long-term vision.

mutable_prompts.description:
Current Focus: Gaining immediate hands-on experience with underwater volcanoes, undersea habitats, submersibles, and ROVs, prioritizing participation in US-based university programs and relevant groups.

Key Interests:  US universities and organizations offering programs or projects in underwater volcanology, undersea habitat design, submersible operation, and ROV deployment;  specific focus on opportunities for direct, hands-on project involvement.  Relevant US-based meetups and scuba events providing networking and skill-building opportunities related to underwater robotics, habitat design, and submersible technology.

Immediate Priorities: Identifying and contacting relevant US universities and organizations; attending relevant meetups and scuba events; connecting with individuals and groups specializing in underwater habitat design, submersible operation, and ROV deployment within the context of underwater volcanology; securing immediate hands-on project involvement.

Research Priorities: Hands-on experience with submersibles and ROVs, particularly within underwater volcanic environments; practical applications of ROVs in underwater volcanic exploration; design, construction, and operation of undersea habitats; identifying key personnel and active research projects at US universities and organizations offering immediate, hands-on participation.  Emphasis on readily accessible avenues for direct project involvement and skill acquisition, specifically related to underwater robotics and habitat technologies.
